abstract: When the Altria Group announced its long-awaited spin-off of its Kraft Foods unit, Wall Street cheered, but not for the maker of Velveeta. The feeling was that once sluggish Kraft, and its portfolio of brands that are about as fresh as a “Brady Bunch” rerun, had been jettisoned, the group’s tobacco brands could realize their full value.
lead_paragraph: When the Altria Group announced its long-awaited spin-off of its Kraft Foods unit, Wall Street cheered, but not for the maker of Velveeta. The feeling was that once sluggish Kraft, and its portfolio of brands that are about as fresh as a “Brady Bunch” rerun, had been jettisoned, the group’s tobacco brands could realize their full value.
